definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated

sentences.english: The admission notice he received from the university rejoiced his mother's heart.
sentences.chinese: 他收到的大学录取通知书使他的母亲心花怒放。

sentences.english: I still feel giddy and excited when he does this.
sentences.chinese: 每次他这样做的时候，我依然心花怒放。

sentences.english: I saw her sitting in her car and I was joyous.
sentences.chinese: 每次看见她坐在车里，我就心花怒放。

sentences.english: Chinese plum flowers bloom in cold winters. ;
sentences.chinese: 梅花在严冷的冬天怒放。

sentences.english: When I give my son a cookie, he is happy.
sentences.chinese: 当我给我儿子一个小甜饼时，他心花怒放。

sentences.english: The flower plants suck to spin Is the gall of be elated.
sentences.chinese: 去吮吸那旋花植物令人心花怒放的毒汁。
依然执着保持着花团怒放。

sentences.english: It's April, and blossom time, and white is the may;
sentences.chinese: 山楂花正白四月里鲜花怒放。

sentences.english: Those three words threw him into a tumult of joy.
sentences.chinese: 这三个字使他心花怒放。

sentences.english: When flowers bloom into April, Luoyang became a sea of flowers.
sentences.chinese: 每当到了百花怒放的四月份，洛阳就成了花的海洋。

sentences.english: will break forth in flowers in all my forest groves.
sentences.chinese: 将怒放在我的丛林繁花中。

sentences.english: THE spring flowers break out like the passionate pain of unspoken love.
sentences.chinese: 春花怒放，就像我那未说出口的爱情的灼热的痛苦。

sentences.english: Finlander spends Christmas just in the violet season.
sentences.chinese: 芬兰在怒放的紫罗兰时节度过紫色圣诞。

sentences.english: The benevolent host, please let the revenge the seductive flower, is in full bloom.
sentences.chinese: 仁慈的主，请让复仇的冶艳之花，怒放吧。

sentences.english: When I give my son a , he is happy.
sentences.chinese: 当我给我儿子一个小甜饼时，他心花怒放。

sentences.english: She's licking her chops at the thought of spending all that money!
sentences.chinese: 她一想到能花那一大笔钱不觉心花怒放。

definition: fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
(of a plant) to be in bud
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
(of a woman, a flower etc) delicate colors
flourishing blossom/a mass of flowers/luxuriant flowers
